comment.author: 21449254@N07
comment._content: This may not be very important, but the designation "East Jordan" might be confusing to the modern reader.  Jerash is in the western part of modern Jordan, north of Amman.  (It's east of the Jordan River, though, which is perhaps why the old photographs are labelled this way?)

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
Hello PipThePony,

Thanks for the information. We pick up caption descriptions from the labels on the lantern slides. You may be right that this refers to its location in relation to the Jordan River. We will leave out the east designation so not to confuse people.

~Angie, Brooklyn Museum Archives
